HumanImpact.li: Twelve people were killed at a multiplex Cinemark theatre in Aurora Colorda during the midnight screening of the film The Dark Knight Rises.
Deadliest shooting since The Columbine massacre on April 20, 1999.
Several other incidents followed this one at other theatres where several other men were arrested for acts of violence or attempting to carry through with an act of violence.
The Presidential Candidates at the time, Barrack Obama and Mitt Romney, suspended campagin advertising and visited victims at Hospitals.
Actor Christian Bale along with other sports teams visited several victims and expressed their condolences.
This once again brought the issue of gun control to the surface of news and politics.

EconomicImpact.li: The Organization The Community First Foundation recieved substantial donations from Warner Bros. to aid the vicimts of the shooting.
The theatre where the incident occurred was shut down for months before reopening on Januray 2013, resulting in a great loss for the theatre owners.
Gun sales in Colorado, Washington, Florida, and several other states grew tremendously after the incident along with an increase in background checks.

ResourcesNeeded.li: Cinemas and theatres around the world began hiring more employess to fill out the roles needed in their security increase.
Companies associated with the film and theatre, Warner Bros. and Cinemark, donated a great amount of time to aid the families of the victims.

WaysToHelp.li: Donations can still provided to the Comunity First Foundation for the families of the vicims of the incident.
Be warry of specific people entering theatres.
Cooperate with theatre employees by not wearing suspicious looking clothing or bringing any possible weapon props to events they might be holding.
